item.title: You been warned
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

It is not illegal to sell currency from a game. Period. TOS are basically contracts. All this means is that the company can execute the penalties they put in the TOS. This amounts to a ban at worst. Breach of contract is not a crime.

One thing they /can/ do is file any number of lawsuits against you. At least in the USA frivolous lawsuits are very common. You don’t even have to have a case to file a lawsuit. This doesn’t mean you’ll win, it just means you can file one. In order to WIN you need to ‘prove harm’. If the company can prove that you harmed them then they will probably win. The judgement is a whole different thing. For example, if a company can prove that your bots disrupted service for X number of customers which led to downtime which led to engineers having to work specifically for investigating you, the company can come after you. If they have a team of 10 engineers working a 40 hour week to investigate you fully AND your bots were responsible for a server load to cause other paying customers to be unable to play, AND they can prove all this, you will probably be in a little bit of CIVIL trouble.

Civil != Criminal. There is a /huge/ difference.

Mopman is right. TOS are not laws. They cannot go after you criminally for breaking TOS. They CAN go after you for breaking the law by distributing IP and/or copyrighted work. Though IANAL, I had to confer with one for 40+ hours with the company I worked with on this exact topic.

Read full topic

item.title: You been warned
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

I feel this must be said:

3. Isn’t it up to me what I do with my items & account?

No, the terms and conditions state that your RuneScape character, account and items are, and remain, the property of Jagex.

You agree that all intellectual property or other rights in any game character, account and items are and will remain our property.
Does this mean that they can sue huge marketing sites?

Read full topic

item.title: You been warned
item.dc:creator: @Enigma1 Enigma_
item.description:
@Enigma1 wrote:

If their in-game items are Illegal to sell, as they claim, then they have no basis for a lawsuit.
If they aren’t a legal good, they have no monetary value, and as-such do not constitute a loss.

[/quote]

item.title: You been warned
item.dc:creator: @DualRadical DualRadical
item.description:
@DualRadical wrote:

Actually, Fell is right. To create a runescape account, you must agree to Jagex’s terms and conditions.

[QUOTE]Intellectual property rights
Jagex®, RuneScape® and FunOrb® are registered trade marks of Jagex Limited in the United Kingdom, the United States and other countries.

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way (except to the extent allowed by applicable law). You must not use a modified/customised version of the client software or attempt to sub-license it. You must not create or provide any other means by which any Jagex Product may be played by others (including, without limitation, replacement or modified client/server software, server emulators).

Materials (including without limit all information, software, data, text, photographs, graphics, sound and video) placed on any Jagex Product by us or on our behalf are protected by copyright and other intellectual property rights of ourselves or our business partners / suppliers / advertisers. You may not use these materials or any Jagex Product except in accordance with these terms and conditions and for personal (i.e. non-commercial) use only.

You agree that all intellectual property or other rights in any game character, account and items are and will remain our property.

By posting chat or other materials on any Jagex Product, you grant us a non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, royalty free, worldwide license to use and/or modify such materials on any Jagex Product as we see fit.

You agree that by submitting any material of any kind to us for any purpose connected with any Jagex Product (non-exhaustive examples are suggestions and ideas for any game or contributions to any Gallery page), you are giving us a non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, royalty-free license to use and/or modify the submitted materials as we see fit. You agree to waive any moral rights to the extent permitted by law and that you will not withdraw the submission or attempt to make a charge for its use. Furthermore you guarantee that you are the exclusive copyright holder in relation to the submission and that the submission in no way breaches the rights of any other person or entity.[/QUOTE]

Read full topic

rwt is illegal, you’re reselling Jagex’s property for profit.

what property?

… Their game, their gold.

fake money is not property
[/quote]

Its a good debate, but I would like to state something. If a person plays the game legit and makes lets say 5 million gp. It is now their property because they put the time and effort into the game to make that much cash. So they can sell the 5 mill for 2 dollars if they wanted to.[/quote]
Except Jagex state in their TOS that all items and accounts are property of Jagex and by agreeing to the terms (hence creating an account) you agree to that too…
